channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2025030261
item.description:
Report E-2025030261

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-25T18:19:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 20, 2025, three (3) 5-gallon jugs of UN3098 were punctured and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the site. The crew neutralized the materials and collected the spent product with hand tools. All impacted materials and the damaged jugs were containerized in five (5) 35-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025030253
item.description:
Report E-2025030253

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EQ NORTHEAST, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the offloading of this product at destination, driver employed by receiving facility operating forklift inadvertently punctured side of combination package, piercing fork through and into plastic inner packaging. Approx. 1 gallon of material was cleaned up by crew. Most of content release remained within trailer and on floor, a very small amount leaked out onto dirt parking surface and was, likewise, appropriately cleaned up.

item.title: Report X-2025030694
item.description:
Report X-2025030694

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Freight arrived damaged to 064. It is unclear if the pallet splintered and punctured a bag or if a bag was punctured by a nail on the pallet, or a forklift blade, but there was a release under the pallet. The pallet was placed onto dunnage to help contain the spill, but the material is eating throug h the dunnage. The trailer is being moved onto the yard due to the smell. Safety advised CURA will be contacted for remediation. ~~Called CURA and spoke with Ben who advised a crew will be sent out and attempt to determine the cause.~~Ben with CURA advised the damage was caused by a forklift punctur e.

item.title: Report E-2025030241
item.description:
Report E-2025030241

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-28
  • City: Cincinatti
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1912 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XCN. It was reported that approximately 100 gallons of "Aluminum Chloride Solution" were released from a plastic tote due to improper loading. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3115138. Per review of photos, this spill also impacted a drain and concrete under the trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 110-gallons of UN2581 Aluminum Chloride Solution product released impacting 1’x40’ drain, 12’x8’ concrete and 5’x12’ trailer floor due to improper loading. The crew recovered the Aluminum Chloride Solution with absorbents and transferred the remaining product into a new tote and cut up damaged tote. The waste consisted of (5) 55-gallon poly totes containing the Aluminum Chloride Solution impacted boom, pads and oil dry, one drum had the impacted cut up tote. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025030239
item.description:
Report E-2025030239

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-27
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) cups of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025030836
item.description:
Report X-2025030836

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: Bedford Heights
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 25th, during the PM sort a package that was marked and labeled as UN1760, Corrosive Liquid, NOS, 8, II was found leaking. It is unclear what cause the leak, however it was placed into a steel salvage drum, and an amended shippers dec has been requested.
